result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
4:00 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael Patrick Doody Jr. in court.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Michael Patrick Doody Jr. Attorney Rory Eoin O'Sullivan in court for City of Hudson (22TR2472). INCLUDES 22CM491 and 22TR2472. ADA Smestad states there are other more serious pending cases. Atty. Schmidt states there will likely be a global resolution. Atty. O'Sullivan is excused from future hearings. Court sets PSC with Branch II. Bond continues. Adjourned: 4:05 PM. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for continuance of 11/1 PLEAS. Filed by Atty Schmidt. arc      Per RMW: Leave as scheduled. We can re-access the cases tomorrow. Ja advised attys.tfy

9:41 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Melstrom, Clk: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Jeremiah Harrelson for Atty. Schmidt in court for Michael Patrick Doody Jr. Defendant Michael Patrick Doody Jr. in court. INCLUDES 22CM491 and 22TR2472. DE confirms address. Atty. Harrelson requests PLEAS. Court sets PLEAS. Atty. Harrelson requests DE's seized firearm to be released to responsible third-party. ADA Rockow objects. Court reserves on firearm issue at this time. Adjourned: 9:43 AM. kma
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Michael Patrick Doody Jr. appeared by video, in custody. Includes 22CM491 and 22TR2472. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. DE does qualify for PD.
